revision.comment: Mucuri is the most southerly town in the Northeast region
revision.text: {{Infobox settlement |name = Mucuri |official_name = The Municipality of Mucuri |settlement_type = Municipality |image_skyline = Costadourada.jpg |imagesize = 250px |image_caption = Costa Dourada beach and its [[cliff]]s: the first beach in Bahia from south to north. |image_flag = |image_seal = |motto= |image_map = Bahia Municip Mucuri.svg |mapsize = 250px |map_caption = Location in [[Bahia]] |coordinates = {{coord|18|05|09|S|39|33|03|W|region:BR|display=inline,title}} |subdivision_type = [[List of countries|Country]] |subdivision_name = [[Brazil]] |subdivision_type1 = [[Regions of Brazil|Region]] |subdivision_type2 = [[States of Brazil|State]] |subdivision_name1 = [[Northeast Region, Brazil|Northeast]] |subdivision_name2 = [[Bahia state|Bahia]] |established_title = Founded |established_date = 1938 |leader_title = Mayor |leader_name = Jose Carlos Simões (Dr Carlos) ([[Democratic Labour Party (Brazil)|PDT]]) |area_magnitude = |area_total_km2 = 1774.763 |area_metro_km2 = |area_note = |elevation_m = 7 |elevation_ft = |population_total = 42,072 |population_as_of = 2017 |population_density_km2 = 20.1 |population_metro = |population_note = [http://www.ibge.gov.br/home/estatistica/populacao/estimativa2008/POP2008_DOU.pdf IBGE 2008 statistics] |website = |footnotes = |timezone = [[UTC-3]] |utc_offset = -3 |timezone_DST = |utc_offset_DST = |blank_name = '''[[Human Development Index|HDI]]''' (2000) |blank_info = 0.626 – medium[http://www.pnud.org.br/atlas/ranking/IDH-M%2091%2000%20Ranking%20decrescente%20(pelos%20dados%20de%202000).htm] [[UNDP]] }} '''Mucuri''' is a city in the state of [[Bahia]] in [[Brazil]]. The estimated population in 2017 is 42,072 inhabitants. It is the southernmost city in Bahia as well as Brazil's [[Northeast Region, Brazil|Northeast]] region, and the only one from that state to border [[Espírito Santo]]. The city contains part of the {{convert|1,503.75|ha}} [[Córrego Grande Biological Reserve]]. The climate is tropical, warm and mostly humid, with one or two dry months. Average annual temperature is {{convert|22|to|24|C}}, and average annual rainfall is {{convert|1250|to|1500|mm}}.{{citation|url=http://br.viarural.com/servicos/turismo/reservas-biologicas/reserva-biologica-do-corrego-grande/ |title=Reserva Biológica do Córrego Grande|work=Viarural |accessdate=2016-04-15|language=Portuguese}} == References == {{reflist}} {{Municipalities of Bahia}} [[Category:Populated places established in 1938]] [[Category:Populated coastal places in Bahia]] [[Category:Municipalities in Bahia]] {{bahia-geo-stub}}
